Zdravniki pozivajo: Virus se hitro širi, zaščitite se
V ambulantah NIJZ so že začeli cepljenje.
04 Nov 2019, 14:44 by N. Č.



Gripa je nevarna vsakomur, a še posebej so ogrožene skupine: starejši od 65 let, kronični bolniki, majhni otroci (od šest mesecev do drugega leta starosti) in njihovi družinski člani, nosečnice, posamezniki, ki čakajo na sprejeme na bolnišnično zdravljenje, zdravstveni delavci, ki so pri svojem delu izpostavljeni nevarnosti okužbe ali pri delu lahko prenesejo okužbo na druge osebe, in  drugi delavci v nujnih službah, ki so pomembni za delovanje različnih dejavnosti. FOTO:Jure Eržen, Delo



GETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTOSimptome si lahko lajšamo s toplimi napitki, čaji in paracetamolom. FOTO: Vladans Getty Images/istockphoto


LJUBLJANA  – Gripa je zelo nalezljiva bolezen in virus se z lahkoto širi med prebivalci. Po ocenah zanjo vsako sezono zboli od 5 do 10 odstotkov prebivalcev, kar je zelo veliko.V ambulantah Nacionalnega inštituta za javno zdravje (NIJZ) so začeli cepiti proti sezonski gripi, cepljenje pa tako kot vsako leto poteka tudi pri izbranih osebnih zdravnikih. Starejši od 65 let, kronični bolniki, nosečnice in osebe z izrazito povečano telesno maso so v letošnji sezoni upravičene do brezplačnega cepljenja, so sporočili iz NIJZ. Za te skupine prebivalstva je cepljenje še posebej priporočljivo, saj obstaja pri njih večja verjetnost težjega poteka bolezni in nastanka zapletov zaradi gripe.
Kontaktni podatki ambulant in termini za naročanje so dostopni na spletni strani NIJZ.
Stroške za cepljenje starejših, kroničnih bolnikov, nosečnic in izrazito pretežkih oseb v sezoni 2019/20 v celoti krije Zavod za zdravstveno zavarovanje Slovenije (ZZZS) iz obveznega zdravstvenega zavarovanja, cepljenje pa poteka pri izbranih osebnih zdravnikih.Cepljenje proti gripi v ambulantah NIJZ je le samoplačniško. Osebe, ki so upravičene do brezplačnega cepljenja proti gripi, se sicer lahko cepijo v ambulantah NIJZ, vendar je v tem primeru cepljenje samoplačniško.



Pred gripo in drugimi sezonski obolenji lahko ukrepamo predvsem preventivno z upoštevanjem priporočil za zdrav življenjski slog, z raznovrstno prehrano z veliko sadja in zelenjave, rednim gibanjem, sprostitvijo in zadostno količino spanja. To je priporočljivo početi vse leto, saj uravnotežena prehrana in telovadba zgolj nekaj tednov pred časom sezonskih obolenj ne bosta imela želenega učinka.Virusi gripe se prenašajo s kužnimi kapljicami, ki nastajajo pri kašljanju, kihanju in govorjenju. Virusi lahko na površinah preživijo nekaj ur. Če nismo previdni, jih lahko z rokami prenesemo v usta, nos in oči ter se tako posredno okužimo. Znaki bolezni, ki se pojavijo v nekaj dneh po okužbi, so mrazenje, povišana telesna temperatura, suh kašelj, glavobol, bolečine v mišicah in sklepih ter izrazita utrujenost.

Doctors are urging: The virus is spreading fast, protect yourself
Vaccinations have already begun at NIJZ dispensaries.
04 Nov 2019, 14:44 by N. Č.



Influenza is dangerous to everyone, but groups at risk are especially at risk: over 65 years of age, chronic patients, young children (from six months to two years of age) and their family members, pregnant women, individuals waiting for hospital admissions, healthcare professionals , who are exposed to the risk of infection in their work or may pass on the infection to other persons at work and other emergency workers who are relevant to the operation of the various activities. PHOTO: Jure Eržen, Delo



GETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTOSymptoms can be relieved by hot drinks, teas and paracetamol. PHOTO: Vladans Getty Images / istockphoto


LJUBLJANA - Flu is a highly contagious disease and the virus is easily spread among the population. It is estimated that between 5 and 10 percent of the population get sick every season, which is very high. The National Institute of Public Health (NIJZ) clinics have started to vaccinate against seasonal influenza, and the same is done every year by selected GPs. Over 65 years of age, chronic patients, pregnant women and overweight people are eligible for free vaccination this season, NIJZ said. Vaccination is especially recommended for these population groups, as they are more likely to have a more severe disease course and flu complications.
Outpatient contact details and ordering times are available on the NIJZ website.
The costs for the vaccination of elderly, chronic patients, pregnant women and extremely overweight people in the 2019/20 season are fully covered by the Health Insurance Institute of Slovenia (ZZZS) from compulsory health insurance, and vaccination is carried out at selected personal doctors. self-employed. Persons eligible for free influenza vaccination may be vaccinated at the NIPH outpatient clinics, but in this case the vaccination is self-paying.



Flu and other seasonal illnesses can be prevented primarily by adhering to healthy lifestyle recommendations, diversifying your diet with plenty of fruits and vegetables, regular exercise, relaxation and adequate sleep. It is advisable to do this all year round, as a balanced diet and exercise just a few weeks before the seasonal illness will not have the desired effect. Influenza viruses are transmitted through infectious drops that result from coughing, sneezing and talking. Viruses can survive on the surface for several hours. If we are not careful, we can transfer them to the mouth, nose and eyes with our hands and thus become indirectly infected. Symptoms of the disease that occur within days after infection are freezing, fever, dry cough, headache, muscle and joint pain, and extreme fatigue.
